text: Hello! How are you today?
I'm doing well, thanks for asking! How about you?
I'm great! Just finished a big project at work.
That's awesome! What kind of project was it?
It was a mobile app redesign for a major client. Very challenging but rewarding!
Sounds interesting. I've been working on something similar.
Really? Tell me more about your project.
It's a React Native app with some complex animations. Been wrestling with keyboard handling across iOS and Android.
Ah, the classic platform differences. Have you tried using a specialized keyboard handling library?
Yes, I'm testing react-native-keyboard-controller right now. It seems promising.
That's a good choice! I've heard positive things about that library.
Hey Emma! I didn't know you were in this chat too.
John invited me to join the discussion. I've worked with keyboard handling issues before.
Great to have you here! Any specific tips for handling the keyboard in chat interfaces?
I recommend trying different behaviors like 'padding' and 'translate-with-padding' to see which works best for your specific UI.
That's exactly what I'm testing right now! Have you noticed any performance differences between them?
In my experience, 'translate-with-padding' tends to be smoother in chat interfaces, especially with long message lists.
Interesting. I'll pay attention to scrolling performance in my tests.
Don't forget to test with different keyboard types too, like emoji keyboards and third-party keyboards.
Good point. I've had issues with predictive text and emoji pickers in the past.
